owner_contact.address: Level 40, Northpoint Tower, 100 Miller St, North Sydney NSW 2060, Australia

epd_metadata.product_group_classification: UN CPC 375 (Articles of concrete, cement and plaster)

product_description.product_use: Concrete is prepared by mixing cement, coarse and fine aggregates, and water, with or without auxiliary agents and additives. Used in construction for foundations, driveways, footpaths, high-rise buildings, dams, roads, bridges, and other infrastructure.
product_description.hazardous_substances: None of the products contain substances listed in the Candidate List of Substances of Very High Concern for authorisation.
product_description.packaging: Delivered in bulk with no packaging.

lca_information.scope: Cradle to gate (modules A1-A3) with options (modules A4-A5), modules C1-C4 and module D

background_data_preferences: Product specific EPDs for cements, admixtures, pigments and fibres
Australian National Life Cycle Inventory Database (AusLCI v1.42) (2023)

allocation.method: Physical allocation based on weight or m³ of concrete; economic allocation used when physical allocation not possible

excluded: Environmental impact from infrastructure, construction, production equipment, and tools not directly consumed
Personnel-related impacts such as transportation to and from work
cut_off_criteria.included: All materials required for manufacturing delivered via trucks and ships without packaging

data_quality.geographic_representativeness: Good to very good for all data sources
data_quality.temporal_representativeness: All data updated within 10 years as required

installation.operational_control: Holcim does not have operational control over installation
installation.activities_included: Pouring concrete from truck and pump, manual finishing; excludes pre-installation site work and forms

deconstruction.process: Physical drilling and removal using hydraulic excavator

end_of_life.notes: Holcim has no control over end-of-life fate; assumptions based on common scenarios and National Waste Report 2022

carbonation.description: Natural process of CO2 absorption by concrete over its lifetime, partially offsetting emissions

allocation_method.fly_ash: Treated as waste material, only transport impacts included
allocation_method.ground_granulated_blast_furnace_slag: Economic allocation due to significant economic value
allocation_method.silica_fume: Treated as waste material, only transport impacts included

recycled_materials_handling.background_data: Default background data from LCA databases used; AusLCI dataset conforms to EN 15804

product_classification.normal_class: For everyday applications such as residential and commercial foundations, driveways, footpaths
product_classification.special_class: For major construction projects including high-rise buildings, dams, roads, bridges, marine applications, high-strength and decorative concrete

other_life_cycle_stages_not_included.notes: Carbonation (lifetime CO2 absorption) is not considered in this EPD and not reflected in results.

references: Australian Life Cycle Inventory Database Initiative Guidelines (2023)
British Standards Institution EN 15804:2012+A2:2019 and BS EN 16757:2017
Department of Climate Change, Energy, the Environment and Water National Waste Report 2022
EPD International General Programme Instructions and PCR documents (2024)
Scientific articles on carbon footprint of Australia's construction sector
